name: Mixed Berry Jam
description:
Local strawberries, boysenberries, raspberries,  marionberries, and blueberries combine to make a delicious classic Oregon jam for your breakfast table

Try it: Spooned over Greek yogurt and topped with hazelnut granola 

9-oz or 4-oz jar

Ingredients: Strawberries, boysenberries, raspberries, marionberries, blueberries, cane sugar, lemon, fruit pectin

name: Oregon Rarities Gift Pack
description:
Seasonal, unique and rare jams, all boxed up for giving (or keeping).

Citizens, we have some rare gems for you -- perfect for sharing or showing off the bounty of the Pacific Northwest. This boxed set contains one 4-ounce jar of each of the following gems:

Pacific Berry - A rare berry exclusive to the Republic of Jam, this jam is typically sold out more quickly than we can produce it. As fate would have it, a forgotten batch of flash-frozen berries from this summer recently turned up in the farmer's freezer, enabling us to offer it to you one last time until next summer's crop.

Quince Maple - An ancient fruit, the quince is more commonly associated with exotic locales like Turkey, Morocco or Persia -- but they also grow here in Oregon. The fruit, which requires hours of cooking to make into jam, has a strong floral scent and a delicate flavor.

Red Currant Chutney - We've combined these little jewels of fruit with mustard seed and cider vinegar to make a tangy, savory chutney perfect to serve alongside your Christmas ham or a pork tenderloin.

Huckleberry - Because huckleberries are nearly impossible to cultivate, they must be painstakingly wild-picked and are typically blended with other more commonplace fruits to make jams. Not so in the Republic: ours is all huckleberry, all the time. We've never been able to offer a huckleberry jam before, and we don't know when or if we'll be able to do it again -- so it's exclusively available only in this boxed set.

If you are shipping to multiple addresses, complete a separate order for each address.

To include a note with your gift, click on the "Note to seller" link during checkout.

name: Shake: A New Perspective on Cocktails (recipe book)
description: Shake is a unique cocktail book that expresses a seasonal and straightforward approach to drinks and entertaining, and reminds us that mixing cocktails should be simple, social, and, above all, fun. Our genuine hope is that this book inspires you to take delicious cocktails out of the bar and into your hands -- and helps you do just that. A great little gem of a book from the folks at Mason Shaker.

name: Mason Jar Cocktail Shaker from W + P Designs
description:
Party perfect. Create RoJ cocktails in style with these handsome bar tools by Brooklyn-based W + P Design. Inspired by vintage Americana, they're perfect for adding a hit of southern comfort to your home bar.

One quart (size)
Hand wash. Assembled in USA.

name: Itty Bitty Two-Pack
description:
Need to carry-on some emergency jam for that next long flight? Looking for the perfect thing to throw in your purse, just in case? Want to impress your next date with something sweet, romantic, and sticky? Look no further! For the low price of 5 bucks, you get two of our amazingly flavored jams, in miniature, to satisfy those on-the-go cravings or to give your college-bound nephew as a study aiding gift. 

Two pocket jams, each 1.5 oz. 

Assorted flavors.

name: Smoked Apple Jam
description:
Sweet & tart apples are smoked over pecan and apple wood, then blended with almonds, black pepper & a hint of cider vinegar to make this savory spread.

Try it: on crostini with pancetta, caramelized onion and blue cheese, or as spread on a gooey grilled cheese sandwich

9 oz or 4 oz jar

name: Apricot Vanilla Riesling Jam
description:
The slightly tart notes of apricot are warmed with real vanilla bean.  Riesling adds depth and roundness.

Try it:  paired with a mild, creamy cheese

9 ounce or 4 ounze jar

Ingredients: Apricots, cane sugar, Riesling, orange juice, lemon juice, vanilla beans, orange zest

name: Blackberry Vanilla
description:
Real vanilla beans warm the gamey flavor of local blackberries

Try it:  on something creamy, such as a panna cotta or ricotta pudding

9 oz or 4 oz jar

Ingredients: Blackberries, cane sugar, lemon juice, vanilla bean, fruit pectin

name: Blueberry Balsamic Jam
description:
A twinge of tang from balsamic vinegar adds mystery and intrigue to this jam.

Try it: it’s a natural with creamy cheeses, or use it to top buttermilk ice cream

9 oz jars

name: Pickled Blueberries
description:
Sweet, plump, fresh-picked blueberries provide contrast to a tart, tangy sauce. 

Try it: topping goat cheese or brie for a sophisticated and unusual appetizer.

9 oz or 4 oz jar

name: Boysenberry Orange Jam
description:
Complex but with bright, juicy orange flavor shining through.

Try it: Thinned with champagne vinegar or white wine, then served with orange sorbet.

4 or 9oz Jars

Boysenberries, cane sugar, lemon juice, orange juice, orange zest, fruit pectin

name: Cherry Black Pepper Jam
description:
Tart, bright pie cherries chopped and cooked with minimal cane sugar and black pepper make this jam a unique palate pleaser.

Try it: As an intriguing addition to a batch of brownies

4 or 9 ounce jars

name: Grapefruit Ginger Jelly
description:
The classic combination comes alive in this bright, fresh-tasting jelly. 

Try it: on a warm buttered scone

9-oz or 4-oz jar

Ingredients: Grapefruit, cane sugar, lemon juice, ginger, fruit pectin

name: Kiwi Lemon Lime Jam
description:
Kiwi Lemon Lime

Bright and fresh, both in color and in taste.  We use big chunks of lemon zest to add zing to local (yes – local!) kiwis. 

Try it: warm slightly to increase spreadability and use it to glaze lemon bars or as a layer in lemon cream pie

9-oz and 4-oz jars

name: Preserved Lemons
description:
A staple in Moroccan and Middle Eastern dishes, lemons are cured in salt, spices and their own juices.

Try them: Diced & added to sautéed vegetables, or mixed into butter then smeared onto grilled fish or roasted winter squash.

16 ounce jar

name: Preserved Limes
description: Like preserved lemons, these are cured in salt and spices. In Indian cuisine these are known as lime pickles. Mince the peel and add to anything that needs a bright, citrusy punch of flavor -- such as our salsa recipe. Try it: Minced and added to guacamole, chopped & used as a relish for Indian dishes, or sliced to garnish a bloody mary. 9 oz jar Ingredients: Limes, salt, mustard seeds, fenugreek, cumin seeds, turmeric, red chili flakes

name: Marionberry Cinnamon Preserves
description:
Developed right here in Oregon, and named for our neighboring county, it doesn’t get much more local than this. This jam shows off the deep juicy flavor of Marionberries but with a difference - cinnamon makes the flavor just a bit warmer.

Try it: In muffins with cinnamon streusel

9 ounce jars

Ingredients: Marionberries; cane sugar; lemon juice; cinnamon; vanilla bean

name: Spiced Orange Marmalade
description:
The true beginning of winter is marked by our juicy orange marmalade, enhanced with warm spices.

Try it: Spread on buttery toast and served with Earl Grey -- hot.

9-oz or 4-oz jar

Ingredients: Oranges, cane sugar, water, lemon juice, fruit pectin, spices

name: Pacific Berry Jam
description:
They’re back!  These should come with platinum lids! These rare, delicious berries are back in season for a short time only.  There’s a reason that people have been repeatedly asking us when we’d have them back – this is the crème de la crème of jams, as complex and sophisticated as a fine wine.

Try it: This one is to be savored – on fresh-baked bread perhaps? 

9 oz jars

name: Peach Praline Jam
description:
This luscious, creamy peach jam is complemented by the soft crunch of praline bits in every bite. 

Try it: as a glaze for homemade cinnamon rolls.

9 oz jar

name: Plum Vanilla Bay Jam
description:
The flavor of this jam reminds us of black tea – a bit dark and complex from the bay leaf, with sweet plums accentuated by whole vanilla beans

Try it: On a plain cream scone or buttered toast for your morning break

9 ounce or 4 ounce jar

Ingredients: Plums, cane sugar, lemon, bay leaves, vanilla bean, fruit pectin

name: Spiced Quince Jelly
description:
Described as tasting like a perfumed apple, this relative of the pear is used in various cultures in both sweet and savory dishes. This version is combined with quintessential warm baking spices like cinnamon and anise.

Try it: In the classical Spanish pairing, with Manchego cheese

9 ounce jar

Ingredients: Quince, water, cane sugar, lemon juice, fruit pectin, lemon zest, spices

name: Raspberry Vanilla
description:
Whole Madagascar Bourbon vanilla beans provide natural sweetness for juicy local raspberries

Try it: with buttery shortbread and dark chocolate 

4 or 9 ounce jar

Ingredients: Raspberries, cane sugar, lemon juice, vanilla bean, fruit pectin

name: Rhubarb Ginger
description:
A classic combination! The ginger isn’t overly strong; it’s just enough to provide contrast to the tart fruit.

Try it: As a pancake topping

9 oz or 4 oz jar

Ingredients: Rhubarb, cane sugar, lemon, candied ginger, fruit pectin

name: Strawberry Mexican Chocolate
description:
Ingredients: Strawberries, cane sugar, Belgian chocolate, lemon juice, cinnamon, anise, cayenne, black pepper

9-oz or 4-oz jars

name: Apple Lemon Ginger Culinary Syrup
description: Our delectable culinary syrups are great for using in cocktails, sauces, or as an ice cream topping. These are not thick like a pancake syrup, though you could add more sugar and cook it down to make a great pancake topper. Granny Smith apples are tarted up a bit with fresh lemon juice and a zing of ginger. Try it: As a soak for gingerbread 16 oz or 8 oz bottle Ingredients: Granny Smith apples; water; lemons; cane sugar; ginger

name: Blueberry Syrah Black Pepper Culinary Syrup
Cherry Pinot Culinary Syrup
description: Our delectable culinary syrups are great for using in cocktails, sauces, or as an ice cream topping. These are not thick like a pancake syrup, though you could add more sugar and cook it down to make a great pancake topper. The tart, exquisite flavor of local sour pie cherries is complemented with Pinot Noir from Noble Pig Vineyard & Winery in the nearby McMinnville AVA. Try it: This syrup makes a sophisticated drink mixer, or is delicious combined with soda water and a touch of cream for an Italian Cream Soda. 16 or 8 oz bottle Ingredients: Willamette Valley tart pie cherries; cane sugar; Noble Pig Pinot Noir, lemon juice

name: Lemon Vanilla Culinary Syrup
description: Our delectable culinary syrups are great for using in cocktails, sauces, or as an ice cream topping. These are not thick like a pancake syrup, though you could add more sugar and cook it down to make a great pancake topper. 6 ounce bottle Ingredients: lemon juice, cane sugar, lemon zest, vanilla bean

name: Lemon Lime Culinary Syrup
description:
Our delectable culinary syrups are great for using in cocktails, sauces, or as an ice cream topping. These are not thick like a pancake syrup, though you could add more sugar and cook it down to make a great pancake topper.

This classic combo is a natural for refreshing drinks.

Try it: In a margarita, or sip it with seltzer as a home-made Sprite

16 oz or 8 oz bottle

name: Lime Jalapeno Culinary Syrup
description:
Tart and mildly spicy, this syrup is made from fresh limes and jalapeno peppers. It's tropical. It's hot. It's tropihot.

Ingredients: Lime juice, cane sugar, jalapeno peppers

Try it: Excellent as a base for a margarita, or to marinate shrimp. 

8 oz bottles

name: Orange Mango Culinary Syrup
description:
Tropical and refreshing for a cold winter's cocktail

16 oz or 8 oz bottle

name: Quince Maple Culinary Syrup
description: Breakfast and Maple quince are a match made in heaven. Drizzle over crepes, waffles, pancakes, French toast...maybe even bacon...

name: Callebaut Belgian Chocolate Crispearls
description:
Dark or white chocolate covered crispy biscuits add crunch to your baking, or just as a snack. We use these on RoJ Confections.

Try it: on cupcakes, ice cream or in your mouth!

name: Fresh Vanilla Beans
description:
We use these exceptional, fresh and sticky beans in all of our vanilla jams. Don’t use dried up grocery store beans ever again….

Try it: To make a flavorful crème anglaise, custard, ice cream, crème brulee’, or just in place of vanilla extract.

Three beans in a nifty glass vial. 
Did we say nifty? We meant SUPER nifty.

name: Bourbon Vanilla Demerara Sugar
description:
Demerara sugar is a type of unrefined sugar with a large grain and a pale golden yellow color. It has a rich, creamy, molasses-like flavor which enhances baked goods. The large grains remain crunchy through cooking, which makes demerara sugar a great choice of sprinkled topping on scones and similar dishes which might otherwise have a uniform texture.

Pure Demerara sugar is aged with bourbon- and coffee liqueur-soaked vanilla beans to make this treat. We use these exceptional beans in all of our vanilla jams.

Comes in an adorable, reuseable jar.

Try it: Over scones, sprinkled on cookies, French toast or fresh berries

name: Gift Box/Mailer
description:
A sturdy black gift box with the Republic of Jam logo. Holds 4-6 small jars of jam.  Can be used as a mailer for 4 small jars of jam.  

Choose 4 small jars of jam and this gift box, and let us know where to ship your gift, and we'll take care of the rest.  Use the "Note to seller" option during the PayPal checkout process to give us any special instructions.  Shipping will also be calculated within PayPal.
